thread.title: How Much Karina Smirnoff, Derek Hough Are Making to Return to ‘Dancing With the Stars’
thread.title_full: How Much Karina Smirnoff, Derek Hough Are Making to Return to ‘Dancing With the Stars’

author: Elyssa Kirkham
title: How Much Karina Smirnoff, Derek Hough Are Making to Return to ‘Dancing With the Stars’
text:
By Elyssa Kirkham August 19, 2015 
Karina Smirnoff is returning to “ Dancing With the Stars ” (DWTS) for Season 21, along with other pro dancers like Derek Hough and Witney Carson. Julianne Hough, a judge and former dancer on the show, is also returning. 
But how much does a DWTS pro dance get paid? Here’s a look at what the pros of “Dancing With the Stars” are worth and how much they earn on the show. “Dancing With the Stars” Pro Dancers Get Paid $5,000 a Week 
Celebrities who appear on “Dancing With the Stars” sometimes make astronomical amounts off the show, but their salaries for a season start at $125,000 and rise the longer they stay in the competition, according to entertainment news site Wet Paint. But are the pros paid as well? 
Karina Smirnoff confirmed with the New York Post in 2013 that the pros are paid weekly; the longer they last in the competition, the more they make. According to another report from 2009, salaries were around $5,000 a week, reports Wet Paint. But the pro dancers’ salaries have probably increased even more for DWTS Season 21. Karina Smirnoff Net Worth: $3 Million 
Karina Smirnoff took Season 20 off to promote her book “We’re Just Not That Into You” and appear in an indie film, reports Entertainment Weekly . “I was a little nervous about not dancing on the show at all last season,” Smirnoff said of her season off. “I was doing it for the last 10 years.” 
Most people would probably be nervous to step away from a lucrative job that had made them a multi-millionaire by the age of 37, which is what DWTS has done for Smirnoff. CelebrityNetWorth puts Karina Smirnoff’s net worth at $3 million. Julianne Hough Net Worth: $7 Million 
Julianne Hough has a reason to celebrate heading into Season 21 of “Dancing With the Stars,” as she just announced her new engagement to pro hockey player Brooks Laich. Hough’s bank account also gives her plenty of reasons to be happy, as it’s grown fat through her years as the standout on “Dancing With the Stars.” 
Originally a pro dancer on DWTS, Hough switched to sit at the judges’ table in 2014 and will appear as a judge in Season 21. Her success on the show has also led to other endeavors, from singing in a pop album to starring in several films. Julianne Hough’s net worth is estimated at $7 million. Derek Hough Net Worth: $4 Million 
Derek Hough, brother to Julianne and a fellow pro dancer on “Dancing With the Stars,” is returning for Season 21. In addition to his dance career, Hough has also made some moves to branch out into acting, with his most recent work including a guest role on the TV show “Nashville.” Derek Hough’s net worth is $4 million. 
Read: 5 Celebs Who Could Have Used a ‘Dancing With the Stars’ Paycheck Witney Carson Net Worth: $300,000 
Witney Carson first appeared on “So You Think You Can Dance,” where she wowed audiences but was ultimately eliminated. Following this run, Carson was picked up by the “Dancing With the Stars” Pro Troupe Team in Season 16 and promoted to one of its pro dancers in Season 18. With just a couple of years on DWTS under her belt, Witney Carson’s net worth is around $300,000. Val Chmerkovskiy Net Worth: $1.5 Million 
Val Chmerkovskiy took home the mirror ball trophy in Season 20 with partner Rumer Willis. As the defending “Dancing With the Stars” champ, he’ll be trying to go for a repeat win in Season 21. Val Chmerkovskiy’s net worth is around $1.5 million. 
Other pro dancers returning in Season 21 include Mark Ballas, Allison Holker, Artem Chigvintsev, Sharna Burgess and Peta Murgatroyd. “Dancing With the Stars” Season 21 will premiere on ABC on Monday, Sept. 14, at 8 ET.
